text:
# 
The WCCA Oversight Committee made 24 recommendations related to the electronic access to circuit court records. This document summarizes the actions the Director of State Courts intends on pursuing for each of the 24 recommendations. 

\begin{tabular}{ll}
RECOMMENDATION 1.TheWcCAbulkdatasubscribercontractshould & ACTION \\
require subscribers to update data and restrict the resale of data. & Language changes for the bulk subscriber contract will be drafted. Changes will be reviewed and discussed with the CCAP Steering Committee and theDirectorofStateCourts. \\
2.TheWcCA bulk datasubscription cost should be increased toreflect thecostoftheinfrastructure needed to operate. & CCAP will review the bulk data pricing structure and costs, and present the findings to the CCAP SteeringCommittee and theDirectorofState Courtsfor consideration. \\
3. The WCCA bulk data subscription should include auditing and oversight functionality. & CCAP will research and estimate the time it will take to engineer and cost to implement auditing and oversight functionality for bulk data subscribers. The findings will be presented to the CCAP Steering Committee and the Director of State Courtsfor consideration. \\
4. Display periods for some case information on WCCAshoulddifferfromtheretentionperiodsfor case records under Supreme Court Rule 72. 5. Criminal felony cases with a disposition of & See specific action in #5-10, below. \\
dismissed, including dismissals resulting from deferred agreements, should display on WccA for 2 years or less. & Change the display period on WcCA for criminal felony cases to 2 years where all charges have a disposition of dismissed. Changes will be made by the end of 1"t quarter, 2018. \\
6. Criminal felony cases with a disposition of acquitted should display on WccA for 2 years or less. 7. Criminal misdemeanor cases with a disposition & Change the display period on WcCA for criminal felonycases to2yearswhere allchargeshave a disposition of acquitted. Changes will be made by the end of 1"t quarter, 2018. Change the display period on WcCA for criminall \\
of dismissed, including dismissals resulting from deferred agreements, should displayonWccA for no more than 1 year and no less than 6 months. 8.Criminal misdemeanor caseswith a disposition of acquitted should display onWcCAfor no more than 1 year and no less than 6 months. & misdemeanor cases to 2 years where all charges have a disposition of dismissed. Changes will be made by the end of 1' quarter, 2018. Change the display period on WccA for criminal misdemeanor cases to 2 years where all charges have a disposition of acquitted. Changes will be \\
9. Small claims cases with a disposition of dismissed should display onWcCA for 2 years or less. & made by the end of 1"t quarter, 2018. Change the displayperiod onWccA to 2 years for small claims cases with a disposition of dismissed. Changes will be made by the end of 1't quarter, \\
\end{tabular}

\begin{tabular}{ll}
 & 2018. \\
10. Injunctions under Wis. Stat. Chapter 813 for domestic abuse, child abuse, individual at risk, and harassment,whichresultinadismissaloradenial, should display on WccA for 2 years or less. & Change the display period on WcCA to 2 years for injunctions under Wis. Stat. Chapter 813 for domestic abuse, child abuse, individual at risk, and harassment, which result in a dismissal or a denial. Changes will be made by the end of 1't quarter, 2018. \\
11. No change should be made to the WcCA display period for family cases filed under Wis. Stat. Chapter 767. 12. The ability to view all case documents and & No action needed. No action needed. \\
shouldnotbeallowedonWccA. 13. The feasibility to view case disposition orders on WccA should be studied and a revenue & CCAP will research the feasibility of this recommendation and present findings to the CCAP \\
projection generated. 14.Additional educational opportunities should be offered to circuit court judges on the topic of & Steering Committee and the Director of State Courts for further discussion. This recommendation will be communicated to the DirectorofJudicialEducationfordiscussionwith \\
sealing court documents, but no other changes to sealingshouldbemade. 15.AdisclaimershouldbeaddedtoWcCA explaining that a single case may appear multiple times in search results if a party on the case used & theJudicialEducation Committee. The Office of Court Operations will develop this language and determine the appropriate place for \\
different names. 16. WcCA should continue to display party addresses, unless the addresses are statutorily & posting on WcCA. Changes will be made by the end of 1't quarter, 2018. No action needed. \\
protected or ordered sealed by court order. 17. WCCA should display criminal charge modifiers & Develop these changes. Changes will be made by \\
on the executive summaryofeach case. 18. WcCA should more clearly display criminal charge modifiers in the case summary. & the end of 1t quarter, 2018. Develop these changes. Changes will be made by \\
19. The WCCA FAQ section should include hyperlinks to statutory cites or other easy-to- understand definitions for commonly used words & the end of 1" quarter, 2018. The Office of Court Operations will review the FAQ section on WccA for appropriate links and work with CCAP to post them by the end of 1"t quarter, \\
in court proceedings. 20. WCCA should display class codes used in criminalcases. & 2018. Develop these changes. Changes will be made in 1st quarter, 2018. \\
\end{tabular}

\begin{tabular}{ll}
21. WcCA should not delay displaying case information until after parties have been served. & No actionneeded. \\
22. WCCA should continue to display minutes takeninactionsfiledin circuitcourt. 23. Clerks of circuit court should continue to & No actionneeded. \\
receive training on how to keep minutes, in order to promote standardization. & The Office of Court Operations will work with the WisconsinCircuitCourtClerksAssociationto ensure this topic is periodically reviewed at clerk of circuit court conferences. \\
24.WcCAshouldincludeinformationforfilerson howtorequest a correction to minutes taken in circuit court actions. & The Office of Court Operations will develop this language and workwithCCAP to post itonWcCA in the appropriate location. Changes will be made by the end of the 1't quarter, 2018. \\
\multicolumn{2}{l}{} \\
ChangesNeededtoSCR72RetentionRule PertheRecordsManagementRetention Subcommittee's previous decision, change the retention of criminal cases to be based on case type at disposition rather than case type at filing. The WCCA Oversight Committee deferred this issue because the Retention Subcommittee had & A petition will be submitted to change the language of SCR 72.01(15)-(17) and (18)-(20) from this petition could be heard in fall 2018, for a 1/1/19 effective date. If the petition passes, CCAP will implement these changes. \\
\end{tabular}
